description:
When you receive the dreaded legal letter about intellectual property infringement, what do you need to know so you can determine whether you’re dealing with a patent troll or actual competitor? Keith Bergelt, CEO of Open Invention Network, will discuss four key steps, along with strategies, on how to make the right call.

These steps are:

Step 1: How to identify whether the entity is or is not a patent troll. Keith will discuss what to look for, the top three signs that it is patent troll and more.

Step 2: Determine the validity and seriousness of the threat. Keith will go over what’s really at stake.

Step 3: Don’t feel like you have to make a quick decision. Don’t make decisions you could regret later by acting rash. Keith will go over what you need to know before a decision on your next action is made.

Step 4: Explore declaratory judgment actions. Among other legal strategies, Keith will discuss declaratory judgment actions and what these actions can help you.

Keith Bergelt, CEO of OIN, a company formed by IBM, Philips, NEC, Novell, NEC Red Hat and Sony to protect Linux, will share insights into the ways that open source companies can protect themselves from patent trolls.
title: Tips for When Approached by a Patent Troll
